revised_title: Saturation Transfer in Living Systems: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Techniques for Studying Metabolism
tldr: This article discusses the use of nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) saturation transfer techniques to study metabolic reactions in living systems. The authors demonstrate the application of this method in frog muscle, rat heart, and yeast cells, providing unidirectional rate constants for metabolic processes. The technique offers a non-invasive way to study metabolism and provides valuable constraints for modeling high-energy phosphate flow in living organisms.
